metadata.title: CVE-2024-44082 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Dan Smith and Julia Kreger of Red Hat and Jay Faulkner of G-Researchnoticed a vulnerability in image processing for Ironic, in which aspecially crafted image could be used by an authenticated user toexploit undesired behaviors in qemu-img, including possible unauthorizedaccess to potentially sensitive data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-44082` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ironic-api - 1:20.1.0-0ubuntu1.2
ironic-common - 1:20.1.0-0ubuntu1.2
ironic-conductor - 1:20.1.0-0ubuntu1.2
python3-ironic - 1:20.1.0-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ironic package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:20.1.0-0ubuntu1.2').
